title: How to Hack Your Favorite Android Games with Game Guardian

steps.title: Root your Android
steps.content: Root your Android . As with most apps that can be used to exploit games, the app you'll use to hack your Android's games isn't available for non-rooted Androids.

steps.title: Enable downloads from unknown sources
steps.content: Enable downloads from unknown sources . The Game Guardian app isn't available on the Google Play Store, so you'll need to download it from the Game Guardian websiteâ€”a process which is only possible if you can download apps from unknown sources.

steps.title: Download
steps.content: Download the games you want to hack. Before you install Game Guardian, you'll want to have the games you plan on hacking downloaded onto your Android.

steps.title: Ensure that your Android has a file manager.
steps.content: Ensure that your Android has a file manager. This will allow you to access and install the downloaded Game Guardian file. If your Android doesn't have a built-in file manager, you can download one such as ES File Explorer from the Google Play Store for free.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome .
steps.content: Open Google Chrome . Tap the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Open the Game Guardian download site.
steps.content: Open the Game Guardian download site. [1] X Research source Go to https://gameguardian.net/download in Chrome.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Download this file.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Download this file . It's a purple button near the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Tap Agree & Download.
steps.content: Tap Agree & Download . Doing so will take you to the download section. You may not be prompted to do this or the next step.

steps.title: Tap the top Download button.
steps.content: Tap the top Download button. This will download Game Guardian for Android onto your Android. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap OK when prompted.
steps.content: Tap OK when prompted. Doing so confirms that Game Guardian has been downloaded. At this point, you can proceed with installing Game Guardian.

steps.title: Open your file manager app.
steps.content: Open your file manager app. Tap the app icon for your file manager app (e.g., ES File Explorer) to do so. You can also tap the "Installation complete" notification and then skip the next three steps.

steps.title: Select your Android's default download location.
steps.content: Select your Android's default download location. In most cases, this will be either the SD card or your Android's internal storage.

steps.title: Tap Downloads.
steps.content: Tap Downloads . It's a folder. You should see it near the top of the page, though you may have to scroll down on some Androids.

steps.title: Tap the Game Guardian file.
steps.content: Tap the Game Guardian file. You'll find this file inside of the Downloads folder. Doing so prompts a pop-up window to appear. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap INSTALL.
steps.content: Tap INSTALL . It's in the bottom-right corner of the pop-up window. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap INSTALL when prompted.
steps.content: Tap INSTALL when prompted. This will begin installing Game Guardian. You may first have to select a program with which to install Game Guardian (e.g., Package installer ).

steps.title: Reinstall Game Guardian.
steps.content: Reinstall Game Guardian. Once Game Guardian finishes installing, tap OPEN (or tap the Game Guardian app icon), then tap INSTALL when prompted to allow it reinstall. Game Guardian does this so that any installed games won't recognize it as a hacking app.

steps.title: Open Game Guardian.
steps.content: Open Game Guardian. Tap the Game Guardian app icon, which resembles a purple-and-grey shield.

steps.title: Tap Start.
steps.content: Tap Start . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. This will prompt Game Guardian to begin running, at which point it will minimize into a widget in one of the corners of your Android's screen. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Open a game you want to hack.
steps.content: Open a game you want to hack. While Game Guardian is in widget mode, open the game for which you want to change a value.

steps.title: Tap the Game Guardian widget icon.
steps.content: Tap the Game Guardian widget icon. Doing so brings up the Game Guardian interface.

steps.title: Select the game.
steps.content: Select the game. Tap the name of the game you want to hack. If you stop hacking the current game and begin hacking a new one, you'll instead tap the previous game's icon in the top-left corner of the screen and then select the current game from the list of results.

steps.title: Tap X.
steps.content: Tap X . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so will exit Game Guardian. At this point, you're free to begin hacking your game.

steps.title: Find an on-screen number you want to change.
steps.content: Find an on-screen number you want to change. This could be anything from your score to your current token count in the game.

steps.title: Pause the game.
steps.content: Pause the game. This ensures that the number you want to change doesn't update while you're entering it into Game Guardian.

steps.title: Tap the Game Guardian icon.
steps.content: Tap the Game Guardian icon. This option is in one of the corners of your Android's screen. Doing so brings up the Game Guardian interface. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the right-most magnifying glass icon.
steps.content: Tap the right-most magnifying glass icon. You'll find this icon in the upper-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Enter the number.
steps.content: Enter the number. Type the number that you want to change into the "Value" text box near the top of the screen.

steps.title: Set the "Type" to DWORD values.
steps.content: Set the "Type" to DWORD values. Tap the "Type" drop-down box, then tap Dword in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap NEW SEARCH.
steps.content: Tap NEW SEARCH . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Doing so will prompt Game Guardian to generate a list of values which match the number you entered.

steps.title: Review the number of results.
steps.content: Review the number of results. Typically, your first search will bring up a long list of results. Your goal is to get this list down to fewer than five results. The more specific the number you input, the fewer results you'll have. If there are already fewer than five results, skip the next step.

steps.title: Play the game some more, then add an updated number.
steps.content: Play the game some more, then add an updated number. Once you've played the game long enough for the number to change (or for other numbers on the screen to change), pause the game, re-open Game Guardian, type the new number into the text box, and tap REFINE . You'll need to repeat this process until you have fewer than five results.

steps.title: Use the resulting code to hack the game.
steps.content: Use the resulting code to hack the game. Once you have fewer than five on-screen codes, you can tap the "Exact Entry" tab (which resembles a speech bubble with a pencil in it), type in whatever you want the original on-screen number to be, and tap YES .

steps.title: Continue to approximate game codes.
steps.content: Continue to approximate game codes. Game Guardian can require some patience, but by using it to determine the code for a specific in-game aspect, you can change things like the number of tokens you have, your high score, and more.
